column1: who bona fide relies on an assurance given to him by a public authority or
one of its officials and is later told the assurance he relied on and acted
upon, sometime with much effort and at great cost to him, cannot be given
effect  to  because  of  a  flaw  regarding  its  vires.  In  such  instances,  the
principle of legality comes into conflict with the principle of certainty and,
the law as it stands now, is that the illegality of the assurance will defeat
the value of certainty which contends that the assurance should be given
